snippet: Port Authority officials, citing rising costs, called for an agency to oversee the World Trade Center site and its memorial foundation, led by Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg.
abstract: Officials of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey call for an agency to oversee the World Trade Center site and its memorial foundation, led by Mayor Michael R Bloomberg; officials say they are concerned about the rising costs of building the museum and about the funds to meet a projected $60 million annual budget once it opens.
lead_paragraph: Port Authority officials, citing rising costs, called for an agency to oversee the World Trade Center site and its memorial foundation, led by Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg.
